turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Now that dinner is over, if you'll excuse us, we're very anxious to discuss ways and means of getting back home.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The first thing we want to do is to cable the Foreign Office. All of England is waiting to hear about my brother. There's a cruiser at Shanghai ready to take him back.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: That's what I mean - mysterious. Mr. Conway, I don't like that man. He's too vague.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We didn't get much information out of him, did we Bob?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: How about you? Do you want to go?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Go? Where?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Home. Away from here. I've got porters to take us back.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Oh, my dear boy, I'm sorry. That's impossible. Why, I have my classes all started.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't care what you've got started. Do you want to go?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Well - no - I think I'd better wait. Yes, yes. I will. I'll wait.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'll wait till you rot!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Yes.  Barney!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: EXCUSE MEÂ–

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Please don't go.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: You promised to come for tea yesterday. I waited for so long.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I haven't even got any cigarettes left!

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: I'll make some for you!  You will come today?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Perhaps.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Please say you will. The days are so very long and lonely without you.  Please . . .

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: All right, I'll be there.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'll tell me some of the things I want to know, won't you?  You'll tell me who runs this place. And why we were kidnapped. And what they're going to do with us!

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: The hell happened?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Hesitated, sir.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm not talking about that.  I'm talking about your choice of targets.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You shot an eight year old girl.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Uh... yes.  Apparently I did, air.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: The hell were you thinking?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Well, I dunno.  I mean, when you looked at all the other options... it just seemed sorta obvious.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Obvious?  Why don't you and I have a little talk about the obvious... outside.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Sir, before you boot me, I just want to explain.  I mean, okay, you got a goat-guy with a hook for a head...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Cowan--

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Wait.  Uh-- sir.  Please.  Anyway.  Hook-head-guy.  I'm thinking "how can he think with a hook for a head?" Answer: that's not his head. Then I think--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Cowan--

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: of course not, cause his head is that thing way on the other side of the road, cause, if you looked at it, the entire sidewalk full of stuff was actually ONE GUY and--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Cowan-- will you shut your god damed mouth?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Yes.  That's true.  Actually, at this point, I just want A job.  Wait. What do you mean... yet?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It means I know you think you got a beat on things.  But trust me, you don't.  You don't even have an inkling of a hint of a clue as to what's really going on in the world.    And if you want to find out even a little, you'll shut up and come with me. And if you don't, fine.  Go with them. Cause I'm not interested in breaking in another little hot-shot only to have him wig or die on me just when I'm starting to count on him.  So forgive me if you don't exactly hear me ringing little bells and whistling welcome aboard, but this isn't the Love Boat.  And I'm not Captain Fucking Stubing.  Now I'm sorry.  But this has been one long, bad day.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: So... this door.  It's... not an exit...  ?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It's not even a fucking door.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: ...touch that.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: What the hell...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Kids' game a couple galaxies over.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: I guess I lost:

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You got smeared.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We have one motto: Peace on Earth.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: And Goodwill Toward Man?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: No. just peace on Earth.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: I gotta be honest about something.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Once I thought the biggest thing I'll ever do was guard the president.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Oh, you'll still, be guarding him.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It's easy.  You work your way up the secret service, one day stand with the President, meet the most important people on the planet, fulfill your dreams, live happily ever after.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: And if I say yes?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Lose your name and identity, work endless hours an behalf people who don't know you exist, and abandon any hope that you might one day feel even the slightest bit sure of your place in the universe.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: ... think that maybe my supervisors referred me here because of certain issues which I assure you I have spent a good deal of time working very hard to correct--

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Your supervisors have no idea why you're here.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: They don't?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: They don't.  Now, son.  If you get the job, you're going to be working with some very particular people who like to do things in some very particular ways.  Here's a little piece of advice:    Don't use this so much.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: What's so funny, cadet Cowan?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: I... I don't know, air.  This guy. Mr. "Best of the best of the best... " I don't know.  It's just still find it a little...  humorous.  I'm sorry.  Sir.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Well... you know, when you say "normal," what, exactly...

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: For instance...  It says here you lost your parents at 15, and, since then...

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Sir.  I thought those records were sealed.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: We're the government, Cowan.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: You think we're nuts.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: No-- it makes sense.  Cause I gotta tell ya, when I was in third grade they told me I was crazy cause I swore that our teacher was from, like, Venus or something.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Mrs. Edelson?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Only the damn guy won't know it.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: What happens if I say no?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: From now on, you'll respond only to the name "Jay." You'll dress in appropriate attire specially sanctioned by the INS Special Services. You're not to stand out in any way.  Understand?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Everybody, listen up: we've had a tremendous amount of movement lately. Be aware.  Be safe.  Have a good day.  Oh, uh... Cowan?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Yes, air? -- OOOMPH.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Hell of an assistant, isn't he?  Damn guy moves so fast, he actually gets there before you even ask for him.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Sorta literally gets ahead of himself.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Hang on. -- And this is the good part; when you're fully ordained, he'll come when you call him, too.  Dave.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: So... wait.  You just asked... but he goes so fast, he actually brought what you asked for before you asked for it.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: His physics are a little different than ours.  Don't worry

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: It'll make sense later?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: No. But You'll get used to it.    Welcome to the Men in Black.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Sorry, Cowan, I found out literally just before the ceremony.' Apparently you're to report for further review.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Further... what are you talking about, air?  That makes no sense-- I hold three cadet class records--

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Actually, it didn't come from me.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Bull... loney- Sir.  I'm sorry.  Sir, I'm sorry. Sir.  I just, I find it hard to believe that it didn't come from you.  I mean, everything here comes from you.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Well this didn't.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Then where did it-- ? Sir.  Forgive me, but it makes no sense. worked my ass off to grad--

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Look. I don't know why.  I could guess, however.  Maybe it's your attitude.  Or that you're not even close to a team player.  Or that you always seen to think you know more than your supervisors.

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Actually, sir--

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Cowan.  Do you ever think that maybe, just maybe, other people might be right and you might be wrong?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: All the time, sir.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: COWAN
turns.text: Yes, air.  But I'm usually wrong. Sir.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Which do you have your money on, Dee?

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: I'd go with number three.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Three, huh?  Really? Cause a cup of coffee says we're talking about... number... four?  Huh?  No?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Mikey.  Hold it, Mikey-- I want you to talk to me.  Mikey.  I'm telling you.. don't make me... Mikey   Gimme the 140.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Oh. Shit. it's in the car--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What?  I thought you just--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Little more burn on the perimeter-they weren't roasting smores here. Dig out this hole a little.  Cmon, I know it's late, but the sooner we get it right, the sooner we'll all be home.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Kay, I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  Four-Eyes'll run a track on him.  We'll get that son of a... whatever the hell he's the son of.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Kay, listen, I dunno what got into--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  It's been a long night.  Speaking of which-- you owe me a cup of coffee, remember?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I wasn't scared...

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Oh yeah?  The hell you weren't. Little pither just out of school...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Grab the coffee, will ya?  I told Zed I'd give him a buzz.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Listen-- do me a favor-- don't mention the 140 thing--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Helluva night, isn't it?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yup.  Sure is.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: 'Hell, I may as well do something useful.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Dee, you've been useful for 50 years.  We're clueless, you're tired. Why don't you go home and get some rest.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Home?  You gotta be kidding me.    Black?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Dee.  God damn it.  I told you to go home.

turns.speaker: DEE
turns.text: Kay...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We'll take it from here.

turns.speaker: INS LEADER
turns.text: What?  Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: INS, Washington.  Special services.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Vayanse. You others, go on.

turns.speaker: INS LEADER
turns.text: Sir--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Pasen al-furgon v larguense de aqui! Take the van and go.

turns.speaker: INS LEADER
turns.text: Sir, you can't just--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: DON'T "SIR" ME-- YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHO YOU'RE DEALING WITH.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: This is a neurelyser. it was a gift from some friends from out of town. I need you to look at it.  This red eye here isolates and measures the nature of the electronic impulses currently in your brain.  More specifically, the ones -for memory, which it will then block.   I said I need you to look right here.

turns.speaker: INS LEADER
turns.text: Why?  What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Actually that's a very good question.  The answer-- if You'll Just look at this Part-- is here.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Underground gas vein.  Next time, be more careful when you shoot off your guns.

turns.speaker: INS LEADER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You heard me.  You two, especially.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well, how about if I guess, then? Black: Vast space.  Deep. Spiritual. The essence of infinity.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We wear black.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Oh. Right.  I guess that's kind of cool, too, in it's own way.  Course, this isn't really black; it's kind of a dull, dirty, tarry sort of noncolor, isn't it?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: The point is to not call attention to ourselves.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I understand.  Hey, it works for the Hasids, right?  No one recognizes them.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: It's a bug.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: But not a BUG bug-- it's an insect.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: So... lemme get this straight.  We got the use of all sorts of technology from all sorts of other planets.  We got information no one else in the world is privy to.  And we're in a 1986 Ford LTD about to go look at an insect?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: So what's the problem?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well, first of all... I gotta think we could still blend in pretty nice in a Ferrari Testerrosa.  I mean, there is a lot of `em on the street these days, and... uh...

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I tell you, if we really wanted to bland in, that'd what we'd be wearing.  I think it'd be a good look for you, too.  I'll even help you choose a tattoo.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It's the way we do it.  The way we've always done it.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I know, but we're on a college campus...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: This is a college?  I'm sorry, I thought it was a carnival.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I think she's the alien.  In any case, she's clearly spent my too much time alone in this room.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Keep her out of here while I check it out.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I'm, uh... real curious about your met up here. I see you have the, uh, double-office-type thing going here..

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I'm just saying it was cold.  I think she kind of liked me.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: She didn't even know you. .

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I know, that's usually the only time I actually have a shot.  And what if I wanted to see her again?  I'd have to completely re-introduce myself.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Such a shame, too.  Cause you made such a good impression the first time.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Hey, I was workin' her.  I was workin' my thing.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Just so I understand... you're "thing" is... acting like an idiot?  Or is it actually being an idiot?  Besides--

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I know, I know.  I read the manual. No attachments.  We work alone. Blah. blah.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: If you don't have anyone to tell, you won't tell anyone.  Believe me, you get used to it.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I think you're too used to it.  If you ask me, you've been doing this job too long.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You don't know the half of it.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What'd you do before this, anyway? Wait-- let me guess. Ice sculpture? Rock?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I taught kindergarten.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Ha ha.  No, really.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It was a long time ago.-

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well, one thing's for sure.  You could certainly lighten up.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Why?  Well, it wouldn't hurt you to have a little more fun.  I know I don't know you all that well, but--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You don't know me at all.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Um-- Kay?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Kay, um... how, uh, fast does this thing actually go ... ?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Let's see... that was second gear..Kay shifts into THIRD.  Jay winces.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Something seem unusual to you about that?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Uh... you mean... a family of sixeyed, red-faced space creatures travelling to New Mexico to have dinner with their cousins, the invertebrates?  Seemed pretty god damned ordinary to me.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: If it was just a meal, why did they have so much luggage?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I dunno.  Maybe it was baby supplies, Kay starts the car, starts to pull a U-turn.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Let's check am out.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: what's this?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It's an Edna named after Zed's ex wife.  All you do is at the target. The scope matches the image with the image on your retina. The barrel will find the target on its own.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Well, Mr. Intuition... When the neighbors report screaming and we hear nothing but silence, what does that lead you to believe?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I guess it's simple, huh?  They're either gone... or dead.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Or someone has a nitrogenizer.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: History's proven that where there's a nitrogenizer, there's a 12-legged signazoid.  They use it to make our food digestible for their systems.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: A signazoid's eleven thousand pounds. I think we'd know if held left.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Then wouldn't we also know if he's here?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Hold it.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: He's a slimy little slithering scumwad is what he is.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: There's gotta be a hundred pawn shops in downtown Philadelphia.  I take it there's a reason we're going to this one.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: There's a god damn good reason.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Something's wrong here.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Gee.  You really think?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Jeebs is eager to have me deport him. But would rather kill himself than go downtown. Why?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I dunno. Why did that family need all their luggage for a dinner?.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Why did Mikey leave Nazca?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: And what's this ... ?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Looks like a train ticket.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What's going on, Kay?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I don't want to rattle you, but Dee was here for the War of the Worlds.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: The radio show?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: No. The aliens organized, all of them, and tried a coup. They made it seem like a radio show afterwards.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You think that's what's-happening?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I think that's what's happening...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Ernie Goose?  Cynthia?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: That's the Loch Ness Monster.  And... Kay-- that's... 444-Eyes?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Get back in the car!

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Jesus Christ...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We're rising.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Where's it coming?  Where's he landing?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: The Pentagon.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: "Perhaps we shoulld take a lesson from our dinosaurs..."

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I dunno, man.  Maybe we should.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  Fill us in, why don't you.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What if he's telling the truth?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You know something?  I actually never think of that.  I gotta get some coffee.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Kay--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Hang on.  There's gotta be something on this guy.    Did you contact the Alliance?  Do they have anything?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: He's here to help!?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Yes.  Well, in his own mind, yeah.  What if, from his point of view, he is?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: How does that help me?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well... if you think about it, then it would mean that maybe everything he's saying is true.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Great.  Fine.  Listen, why don't we call the pentagon, maybe they'll take you back with the new age well wishers.  I'll stay here and go extinct with the dinosaurs.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Kay.  All I'm saying--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I know what you're saying.  And I'm telling you I don't trust him--

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I know you don't trust him.  You don't trust anybody--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Cause I've been doing this thirty years and if I don't know when something doesn't feel right by now--

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: That's my point.  For thirty years you've been looking through things and under things and behind things. Well what I'm saying is maybe this is a time where you should look right at things.  He said our enemy in already here.  Well maybe it is.  Maybe our enemy is, literally, already here.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Everything left the planet, right? Except one thing.    That little insect-- the one we found in Sudbury.  Did it leave when everything else left?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Since how long?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Since as long as we've been keeping records...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Maybe they didn't get here.  Maybe they've been here.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: For how long?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We saw it in the office.  It went from this big...    to big...   in a day.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well, if the bugs have hatched, and they're not here... then where are they?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It's marble.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: All of it?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Would you call this a code 100?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'd double it and add 20.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm going to try and cut him off at the hotel.  You guys get to the Memorial.   Keep this stuff hidden.  The last thing we need is some over-zealous Secret Service twirp to...

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Do his job.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Right.  Oh, and here.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Wow... this one's cool.  And it looks just like a shotgun.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Actually, it is a shotgun.  Hold onto it--

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: in case I need it?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: In case I need it.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Do IT!  SHOOT HIM!

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Kay!?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You were saying?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Getting eaten!? That was your plan!?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: After I got the shit beat out of me!

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: And I almost got digested. It goes with the job.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You coulda told me what you were doing.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: There wasn't time, sport!

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Who's she gonna tell, anyway? She only hangs out with dead people.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Not her. Me.    They're beautiful, aren't they? The stars. I never just look anymore and they're beautiful.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Kay, you're scaring your partner.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I haven't been training a partner -- I've been training a replacement.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Oh no, I can't do this job by myself.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I'm just wondering what's so great out there that everyone's trying to get to it?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Or what's no horrible down here that everyone's trying to avoid It?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Why does it feel like the only thing scarier than having a bunch of aliens on the planet... is having then leave the planet?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Yeah.  His dream and our worst nightmare.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You know, there's something we never really thought of...

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Me, too.  I feel a long day coming on.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: I put word out-- you know how long it takes to get the signals across.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Kay.  Seriously.  What if he actually means what he says?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: So, I guess you could say you're really into insects...

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Actually, they disgust me.  But that's what I love about them.  Like a car wrack, you know, how you shouldn't look, but you always pull over and watch real close, or even pretend you're a reporter so you can get even closer and take pictures?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Or when someone has a hideous birthmark and all you do is stare.  I really like that.  Let the other girls have the guys like you. Chiseled jaw, perfect nose, quirky dimples.  I find you all so boring.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I'd prefer if you were just a little more blunt.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: So... how'd you hear about this?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Oh, yeah, well, you know.  I'm a big fan.  I've read all your work.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Yeah, right.  Even I can barely read all my work.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Right, right-- I like that stuff.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: With exclusionary frecto-inhibitors?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Exactly.  I very much enjoy that.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Do have any idea what I just said?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Once-- just once-- I thought I'd made the discovery of a lifetime...

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Actually, you may have.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: It's hard to find.  It's an old civil war cemetery.  Nobody ever goes there.  So... what is it you say you do?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I guess you could say we're entopologists of a sort.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I don't think so.   I mean, him, he could be a scientist, maybe.  But you...  Exterminator, I'd understand.  But entopolgist?  No way.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Well, first of all, it's entomologist.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I swear to God, that was not here two days ago...

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: It's the most amazing insect nest I've ever seen.  And I'll tell you one thing, it sure as hell ain't the Andean Mollatoosa.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: But it's definitely a nest, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Man, hey-- maybe you are an entopologist after all.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: It would've had to have been recently-- within a few weeks.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: So... how did they get here?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What do we do?    Lean into it.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: What the hell does that mean?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Actually... I don't know.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Is it my eyes... or is that thing a little...

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Out of focus?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Okay.  If you've got a bug problem-a big one.  And they're swarming and there's no way to shoot them all individually... how do you get rid of them?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: The only thing I could think of would be... you'd have to get rid of the queen.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: What if you have the foggiest clue as to where the queen is?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Are you sure you don't?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: They respond to fear, right?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Yeah ... ?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well I'm going to give them something to be afraid of.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What a coincidence, cause I was just thinking about you, too, Jack.  Recognize this?

turns.speaker: JEEBS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Maybe you need a closer look.

turns.speaker: JEEBS
turns.text: The kid looked desperate.  I figured...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You figured what?

turns.speaker: JEEBS
turns.text: I figured it didn't matter.  It's my last day of business.   I was wrong.  I'm sorry.  Hey, look what I got for you-- a free-floating plasma pad? --One of the good ones, too, with zoids.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Your licence is revoked. Permanently.

turns.speaker: JEEBS
turns.text: I understand.  I understand, thank you. --How about a transmographic dexahydrochlorophallomixaloosalyser?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: And I'm arranging deportation papers.

turns.speaker: JEEBS
turns.text: Yes.  Yes, that's eminently fair of you.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: And I'm bringing you in and locking you up until you tell me--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Let's go, Jeebs.  Downtown.

turns.speaker: JEEBS
turns.text: You're not taking me in!

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Pardon me.  I hate to break up this lovely little group hug, but we people aren't ready for what we have.  How is this going to help?

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: How could it not?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Why don't you ask the Mosebacke?     Brazil. Until 44 years ago they ate with their hands, lived in huts, and didn't even know the rest of the world existed. 44 years ago a well intentioned missionary gave them a fork.  Today, they don't exist.

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: Come on now.  People are smart.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: No-- a Person is smart.  People are dumb.    And the more people you put together, the dumber they get.  And you know that.
